snippet: Shiite doctors who treated protesters never should have been arrested. Imprisoning them will only feed the Shiite majority’s legitimate resentment of the Sunni-led monarchy.
abstract: Editorial criticizes the High Criminal Court of Appeal in Bahrain for upholding the conviction of Shiite doctors who treated protesters during the popular uprising against the Sunni-led monarchy; urges the Obama administration to do more to persuade Bahrain of the need for reforms that give Shiites full political rights and all citizens a voice in their country's future.
lead_paragraph: Shiite doctors who treated protesters never should have been arrested. Imprisoning them will only feed the Shiite majority’s legitimate resentment of the Sunni-led monarchy.

headline.seo: Bahrain Compounds the Injustice With Doctors’ Convictions
